html:
** EV maker's shares RIVN.O up 0.8% at $88.03 premarket - set to snap a four-day losing streak

** RIVN on Thursday fell as much as 16.5% to hit a record low of $75.13, before paring losses to close ~3% down

** The tumble in the previous session came alongside a selloff in other EV stocks as the race for market share intensifies and legacy cos ramp up their own production (Full Story)

** It also happened a day after RIVN investor and customer Amazon.com Inc AMZN.O tied up with Stellantis NV STLA.MI to deploy smarter cars and cleaner vans (Full Story)

** ~40 mln RIVN shares traded in the last session, over 3x their 25-day moving avg

** On Thursday, Tesla TSLA.O fell 2.15%, Fisker FSR.N dropped 2.97%, while Lucid LCID.O closed up 4.2% and Nikola NKLA.O gained 3.34%

** So far this week, market participants have rotated out of tech-heavy growth shares after the U.S. Federal Reserve indicated it might raise interest rates sooner than expected (Full Story)

** Up to last close, RIVN rose ~12% over Nov. 10 IPO price of $78


(Reporting by Akash Sriram in Bengaluru)

(( Akash.Sriram@thomsonreuters.com ;))
